cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi (340 km) SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwestern Caribbean Sea, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday and then track north-northwest through the central Gulf toward the northern U.S. Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern U.S. Gulf Coast (most likely southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings in effect yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from east Texas to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind probability peaks at 43% with the earliest reasonable arrival late Sunday; 19% chance of 50-kt winds and 7% of hurricane-force (64-kt) in the 5-day period.
weather_observation.storm_surge: With current track east of the port, significant storm surge (>3 ft) is not expected at Port Arthur, but minor coastal flooding cannot be ruled out if the center jogs west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands on the western side of Ida could bring 2â€“4 inches of rain to southeast Texas; localized totals above 4 inches are possible if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast beginning this weekend; brief tornadoes possible in outer rainbands Sunday night into Monday.
